results.title: Evaluation of the Effect of Atenolol Induced Depression in Cardiac Output on Its Own Excretion through Urine Analysis
results.text_hl: ., 2001 supports our results who concluded that @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ causes an early significant @<m>DISEASE_Cardiac_Output_Low</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002303 @@@reduction of heart rate and CO@@@.

citations.NLM: Khan S, Mahmood W. Evaluation of the Effect of Atenolol Induced Depression in Cardiac Output on Its Own Excretion through Urine Analysis Iran J Pharm Res. 2019 Winter;18(1):523-530. PMID: 31089386

results.title: Haemodynamic long-term effects of a new beta-adrenoceptor blocking drug, atenolol (ICI 66082), in essential hypertension.
results.text_hl: 1 Thirteen @SPECIES_9606 @@@men@@@ with untreated @DISEASE_Essential_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D000075222 @@@essential hypertension@@@ in WHO stage I were studied on an @SPECIES_9606 @@@outpatient@@@ basis to evaluate the haemodynamic long-tern effect of a new beta-adrenoceptor blocker, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@. 2 @CHEMICAL_Oxygen @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010100 @@@Oxygen@@@ consumption, heart rate, cardiac @<m>DISEASE_Cardiac_Output_Low</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002303 @@@output@@@ (Cardiogreen) and intraarterial branchial pressure were recorded at rest in a supine and sitting position and during steady state work at 300, 600 and 900 kpm/min. 3 The subjects were treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (dose 100-200 mg/day) as the sole drug for 1 year and the haemodynamic study was repeated. 4 The blood pressure was reduced approximately 18% both at rest and during exercise, the heart rate approximately 25% and the cardiac @<m>DISEASE_Cardiac_Output_Low</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002303 @@@output@@@ 16% at rest supine and 27% at rest sitting.

citations.NLM: Lund-Johansen P. Haemodynamic long-term effects of a new beta-adrenoceptor blocking drug, atenolol (ICI 66082), in essential hypertension. Br J Clin Pharmacol. 1976 Jun;3(3):445-51. PMID: 973971
citations.BibTeX: @article{973971, title={Haemodynamic long-term effects of a new beta-adrenoceptor blocking drug, atenolol (ICI 66082), in essential hypertension.}, author={Lund-Johansen P}, journal={Br J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={3}, number={3}, pages={445-51}}

results.title: [Haemodynamic response to antihypertensive treatment with atenolol in patients with hypertension (author's transl].
results.text_hl: These results lead to the conclusion that the antihypertensive action of the cardioselective beta-blocker, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ is based on a lowering of the increased peripheral vascular resistance and a @<m>DISEASE_Cardiac_Output_Low</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002303 @@@reduction in cardiac output@@@; the latter mechanism is predominantly found in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Hyperkinesis @DISEASE_MESH:D006948 @@@hyperkinetic@@@ features.

citations.NLM: Zilcher H, Glogar D, Uhlir H, Leisch F, Niederberger M, Steinbach K. [Haemodynamic response to antihypertensive treatment with atenolol in patients with hypertension (author's transl]. Wien Klin Wochenschr. 1978 Sep 1;90(16):611-6. PMID: 695651
citations.BibTeX: @article{695651, title={[Haemodynamic response to antihypertensive treatment with atenolol in patients with hypertension (author's transl].}, author={Zilcher H and Glogar D and Uhlir H and Leisch F and Niederberger M and Steinbach K}, journal={Wien Klin Wochenschr}, volume={90}, number={16}, pages={611-6}}

results.title: [Effect of atenolol and propranolol on systemic and regional hemodynamics].
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ provoked a @<m>DISEASE_Cardiac_Output_Low</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002303 @@@decrease in cardiac output@@@ and raised the total peripheral resistance without a detectable effect on blood pressure.

citations.NLM: Medvedev OS, Iuzhakov SD, Mashkovskiĭ MD, Val'dman AV, Ismailov ShI. [Effect of atenolol and propranolol on systemic and regional hemodynamics]. Biull Eksp Biol Med. 1983 Jul;96(7):59-61. PMID: 6871455
citations.BibTeX: @article{6871455, title={[Effect of atenolol and propranolol on systemic and regional hemodynamics].}, author={Medvedev OS and Iuzhakov SD and Mashkovskiĭ MD and Val'dman AV and Ismailov ShI}, journal={Biull Eksp Biol Med}, volume={96}, number={7}, pages={59-61}}

results.title: Effect of atenolol or prazosin on maximal exercise performance in hypertensive joggers.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ also increased @DISEASE_Stroke @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@ volume and the arterial venous @CHEMICAL_Oxygen @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010100 @@@oxygen@@@ difference and reduced @<m>DISEASE_Cardiac_Output_Low</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002303 @@@cardiac output@@@ during cycle exercise.

citations.NLM: Thompson PD, Cullinane EM, Nugent AM, Sady MA, Sady SP. Effect of atenolol or prazosin on maximal exercise performance in hypertensive joggers. Am J Med. 1989 Jan 23;86(1B):104-9. PMID: 2913765

results.title: Comparison of the effects of a cardioselective and a nonselective beta-blocker on portal hypertension in patients with cirrhosis.
results.text_hl: One hour after p.o. administration of 100 mg of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Cardiac_Output_Low</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002303 @@@cardiac output@@@ decreased by 32%, and portal venous pressure by 16%; the decrease in @<m>DISEASE_Cardiac_Output_Low</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002303 @@@cardiac output@@@ and the decrease in portal venous pressure were significantly correlated.

citations.NLM: Hillon P, Lebrec D, Muńoz C, Jungers M, Goldfarb G, Benhamou JP. Comparison of the effects of a cardioselective and a nonselective beta-blocker on portal hypertension in patients with cirrhosis. Hepatology. 1982 Sep-Oct;2(5):528-31. PMID: 7118065
citations.BibTeX: @article{7118065, title={Comparison of the effects of a cardioselective and a nonselective beta-blocker on portal hypertension in patients with cirrhosis.}, author={Hillon P and Lebrec D and Muńoz C and Jungers M and Goldfarb G and Benhamou JP}, journal={Hepatology}, volume={2}, number={5}, pages={528-31}}

results.title: Treatment of hypertension in pregnancy: effect of atenolol on maternal disease, preterm delivery, and fetal growth.
results.text_hl: METHODS: A retrospective review of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ treated in early pregnancy with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ was conducted.

citations.NLM: Easterling TR, Carr DB, Brateng D, Diederichs C, Schmucker B. Treatment of hypertension in pregnancy: effect of atenolol on maternal disease, preterm delivery, and fetal growth. Obstet Gynecol. 2001 Sep;98(3):427-33. PMID: 11530124

results.title: The effects of single-dose atenolol, labetalol, and propranolol on cardiac and vascular function.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ both significantly @<m>DISEASE_Cardiac_Output_Low</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002303 @@@reduced cardiac output@@@ (-0.55 vs. -0.31 L/min) and heart rate (-8.0 vs. -6.6 bpm), whereas @CHEMICAL_Labetalol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007741 @@@labetalol@@@ had no effect on either parameter (-0.08 L/min; + 1.0 bpm).

citations.NLM: Holtzman JL, Finley D, Johnson B, Berry DA, Sirgo MA. The effects of single-dose atenolol, labetalol, and propranolol on cardiac and vascular function. Clin Pharmacol Ther. 1986 Sep;40(3):268-73. PMID: 3742933

results.title: Prevention of preeclampsia: a randomized trial of atenolol in hyperdynamic patients before onset of hypertension.
results.text_hl: Mothers of the smallest infants who were treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ could be identified by unexpectedly large @<m>DISEASE_Cardiac_Output_Low</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002303 @@@reductions in cardiac output@@@.

citations.NLM: Easterling TR, Brateng D, Schmucker B, Brown Z, Millard SP. Prevention of preeclampsia: a randomized trial of atenolol in hyperdynamic patients before onset of hypertension. Obstet Gynecol. 1999 May;93(5 Pt 1):725-33. PMID: 10912975

results.title: Hemodynamic assessment of nicardipine alone and with atenolol in coronary artery disease using a modified echo-Doppler device.
results.text_hl: When @CHEMICAL_Nicardipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009529 @@@nicardipine@@@ was given after the cardioselective beta blocker @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ the reduction in heart rate @<m>DISEASE_Cardiac_Output_Low</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002303 @@@and cardiac output@@@ after @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ was reversed compared with a group that received @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ followed by placebo.

citations.NLM: Silke B, Zezulka AV, Verma SP, Taylor SH. Hemodynamic assessment of nicardipine alone and with atenolol in coronary artery disease using a modified echo-Doppler device. Am J Cardiol. 1989 Oct 17;64(15):28H-34H. PMID: 2801572
